revised_title: The Unity of Type in Fossil Plants of the Coal Measures: A Study of Calamites
tldr: The author investigates the organization and structure of fossil plants from the Coal Measures, specifically focusing on the Calamites. They argue for the unity of type among these plants, discussing their anatomy, growth patterns, and relationships to modern plants. The study provides a detailed analysis of the various tissues and structures found in Calamites, including the pith, woody zone, and cortical layer.
